ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Don't miss Friday meetings or else you'll have to read a paper!
This is a must take class.
Yes, its obligatory and they will learn much about how to conduct an ethical research.

It is required but I actually found myself excited to go to class. I think in my recommendation to students, my advice would be that, especially for this course, you're only going to reap what you sow. I think ethics in science is interesting and important and I found that the course was engaging. But attitude is important.
The course provides a good foundation of what we need to know as graduate students and future scientists. I would recommend this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The first two or three were helpful discussions about lab culture, publications, and similar worries that we'll actually encounter in lab. The others--not so much.

I think this class was almost an advice class rather than a knowledge class - we were told what was absolutely not allowed, and then given some guidance and wisdom to apply to our research. I liked the class a lot more than I thought I would.
we dealt with several dilemma situation, which i think helped deepened my understanding of what is supposed to be done under such situations.
I broadened my understanding of conducting an honest research career and how to best prevent bad experiences.

It aided in knowledge of the practice of science, generally, because I was able to discuss the expectations I have when I encounter ethically untenable situations in the lab and in my life as a science (which I hope is long). I don't think that there are many open forums to discuss such a broad range of ethical issues in science, and I found it to be very instructive because of the format.
The course provided me knowledge of the science profession that isn't typically learned in a classroom, and yet is critical to know as a graduate student and scientist.
